ygData.subject: Re: Re: Undead drops in Kithicor
ygData.msgSnippet: Yes I know but I remember when I was a newbie I had to worry about griffins and giants all the time now they are rare to find as a newbie. Overall newbies have
ygData.messageBody:
Yes I know but I remember when I was a newbie I had to worry about griffins
and giants all the time now they are rare to find as a newbie. Overall
newbies have it a lot easier now then I or anybody else ever did. A little
toughness to the game isn't going to hurt them at all. It's a lot easier to
buy equipment now as a newbie, it's a lot easier overall to play the game. I
certainly don't remember myself or other newbies asking for teleport's, now
that's a common site. People will get over it aventually and if worst comes
to worst they can travel through Rathe Mountains.

Naeeldar

-----Original Message-----
From: Kimes, Dean W. <Dean_Kimes@...>
To: 'eqbards@onelist.com' <eqbards@onelist.com>
Date: Monday, November 01, 1999 6:54 PM
Subject: RE: [eqbards] Re: Undead drops in Kithicor


>From: "Kimes, Dean W." <Dean_Kimes@...>
>
>Heh heh, except that on most servers there were 150+ people in Kithicor at
>the time. Of course that still wasn't enough to prevent many deaths. I
>agree that high level players desperately need an outdoor zone where they
>can adventure and gain xp and items and have fun. If its Kithicor that's
>cool, a pain in the butt to travel thru but that's life. Why there are no
>high level outdoor zones I cannot say. A high level zone with non-PoF high
>level mobs with big agro radii would be interesting. Dangerous, and o'
lord
>the trains, but interesting.
>
> Kitasi
>
>-----Original Message-----
>From: Dark [mailto:dark@...]
>Sent: Tuesday, November 02, 1999 3:59 PM
>To: eqbards@onelist.com
>Subject: Re: [eqbards] Re: Undead drops in Kithicor
>
>
>From: "Dark" <dark@...>
>
>The thing is the though the high levels need a good fun area to hunt that
>isn't way overcrowded. I was on my necro the other day doing a quest and in
>Unrest the zone had only 19 people in it during prime time. Then CT is just
>as empty to. Then you go and look at Lower Guk and Sol B and see it pakced
>with 50+ people in it. Thanks to the new kith zone and PoH the high levels
>are finnally starting to spreadout. It's a lot better that it's a high
level
>zone then a low level zone.
>
>Kaldaek
>
>-----Original Message-----
>From: Kimes, Dean W. <Dean_Kimes@...>
>To: 'eqbards@onelist.com' <eqbards@onelist.com>
>Date: Monday, November 01, 1999 5:23 PM
>Subject: RE: [eqbards] Re: Undead drops in Kithicor
>
>
>>From: "Kimes, Dean W." <Dean_Kimes@...>
>>
>>I had heard a few complaints from newbies that they were now cut off from
>>travelling to their guild in Qeynos, but since Kithicor was as safe as
ever
>>during the day hours I find this unjustified. It was good to see Verant
>>making some real storyline related changes to a zone. I just wish they
>>could effectively do those sort of things at a lower level, say in the 25
>>range instead of 40. Problem is, all those 40+ level characters would
>flood
>>the zone anyway just to kill everything to see what it dropped, depriving
>>people of an appropriate level from participating.
>>I'll be really surprised if Asheron's Call is much of a threat to EQ.
From
>>what I saw in Beta it was no match for EQ despite the problems in EQ.
>>There were some really sweet weapons a bard could use on some of those
>>undead apparently. sadly I was unable to get any even though most of the
>>people I saw fighting them would have zero use for them. Its a bit
>>irritating to watch a 50th level paladin scooping up no drop piercing
>>weapons.
>>
>> Kitasi
>>
>>-----Original Message-----
>>From: Kevin [mailto:wethington@...]
>>Sent: Tuesday, November 02, 1999 1:33 PM
>>To: eqbards@onelist.com
>>Subject: Re: [eqbards] Re: Undead drops in Kithicor
>>
>>
>>From: "Kevin" <wethington@...>
>>
>>Methinks you are being a bit harsh on Verant. The Kithicor and Lake Rathe
>>events are probably testing grounds for some kind of changes to the zones.
>>Verant has so few people on the Test Server that they have to do things on
>>live servers to see how things will actually work. Trust me Verant has
1.5
>>million reasons per month to want you to be happy. With the retail
release
>>of Asheron's Call yesterday I think Verant is going to be very aggressive
>in
>>retaining and growing their current player base. I don't envy them having
>>to compete against Microsoft.
>>
>>
>>
>>----- Original Message -----
>>
>>> From: Jason Rochelle <Jasroc@...>
>>> Side note: everyone in the zone was saying "I hope hope leave it this
>>> way forever" just like last week in Lake rathe when the pets were
>>> spawning like crazy and everypne was saying "I hope it stays this way".
>>> TWO examples of people LOVING a zone, BOTH of which Verant KABONG'ed.
>>> Makes you wonder if they really WANT us happy.
>>>
>>>
>>> Uldar Ulfangson
>>> 25th bard, Rodcet Nife
